POSITION TITLE
Risk Modeling Intern – Machine Learning

LOCATION
Raleigh, (Remote)

YOUR ROLE
For the first 12 weeks you will be a part of Genworth’s Mortgage Insurance Internship Program which
provides an excellent opportunity for students to gain hands-on experience in achieving business results while developing technical and professional skills. After the internship program is finalized you would continue into a 20hr/week part-time role until May 2022.

WHAT SETS GENWORTH APART
Genworth invests time, energy, and resources to create a worthwhile experience for interns. Interns work on meaningful business projects, but beyond that, they will network directly with leaders throughout the company (all the way up to the CEO), participate in virtual teambuilding events with their internship cohort, connect with the community through virtual volunteer opportunities, and interact with professional development workshops. It’s a unique internship experience that helps interns develop a network of peers and mentors who act as a constant source of engagement and guidance both during and after the internship.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
In addition to the multiple weekly events attended by all interns, you will work with the risk modeling team and continue on with that team for your part-time role. Your work with the risk modeling team will help answer business questions and improve the predictive modeling process using both traditional modeling techniques and machine learning.

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
• First year graduate student or college junior
• Experience in applying machine learning algorithms to data
• Previous coding experience in SAS, R, Python, or a related language
• Ability to communicate complex ideas to a variety of audiences
• Desire to analyze and interpret data in the insurance, banking, or financial services industries
• Preference for candidates pursuing degrees in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Economics, and Finance; all majors are considered, given strong work experience
• Minimum GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
• Proficient in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
• Exposure to insurance, banking, or financial services industries


WHY JOIN?
If you’re a person who works hard and always delivers high quality results and thrives in a collaborative environment, this internship may be a great opportunity for you. At Genworth, we like data, and we use it to drive the best decisions. We’ll help you learn new skills and ways of thinking by utilizing multiple ways to organize and analyze data. During this internship, you’ll build community (both inside and outside our business’ walls), gain useful experience and knowledge working in the Mortgage Insurance field, and contribute to meaningful business projects – we look forward to having you join our team!

COMPANY
Genworth Financial, Inc. is a leading insurance holding company committed to helping families achieve the dream of home ownership and address the financial challenges of aging through its leadership positions in mortgage insurance and long-term care insurance. Headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, Genworth traces its roots back to 1871.

Genworth Mortgage Insurance, headquartered in Raleigh, North Carolina, is a global mortgage insurer with a major presence in the United States, Canada, and Australia. With origins dating back to 1980, Genworth Mortgage Insurance provides primary mortgage guaranty insurance coverage on residential mortgage loans, as well as mortgage pool insurance policies that enhance insurance coverage for various types of mortgage-related securities. Our mortgage insurance can help individuals secure low down payment loans and realize the dream of home ownership faster – even for the first time.

We know we can’t deliver on our mission unless we deliver for our employees. That’s why we’re committed to creating a work environment that fosters inclusion, excellence, improvement and connection. We know each employee contributes in their own unique way and we’re dedicated to supporting every one of them to help them reach their full potential.

Responsibilities

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and learn in a culture that empowers your development. We have created an inclusive, global environment that values the power of diverse talent, backgrounds, and experiences to drive speed, productivity, innovation, and growth.

Our internship program will give you a chance to get real world business experience and build your network before graduation. We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. You will focus on learning how our organization runs, and can be expected to gain valuable insight that can further your interest in your chosen career field.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our 70,000 employees the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. The customers we serve fall within pharmaceutical and biotech companies, hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, universities, research institutions and government agencies. Our products and services help accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, and solve challenges ranging from complex research to routine testing to field applications.

SUMMARY OF INTERNSHIP

The Software Engineering Internship position provides an opportunity for engineering students who are currently pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, or like engineering degree to get hands on experience working with engineers in a fast-paced software design and software quality assurance environment.

The Software Engineering intern will work with small agile teams and contribute to software development projects that augment scientific research in pharmaceutical, bioengineering, and related domains.

THE POSITION STARTS IN JUNE, PAID WORKING 40 HOURS PER WEEK THROUGH AUGUST.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Design, build, and maintain efficient, well designed, and testable Java code
Identify system bugs and bottlenecks, and resolve using effective solutions
Execute full lifecycle software development, contributing in all phases
To uphold Agile team organization using Kanban, Scrum in additional to a suite of Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence, Crucible, Bitbucket, Artifactory)
Provide feedback on specifications and designs
Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements

Qualifications

Student currently enrolled in classes leading to a degree in a computer science, engineering or related discipline
Relevant course in programming, mathematics, database, software design and architectures
Projects undertaken that demonstrates problem solving and research capabilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Following skills are REQUIRED:
Languages: Java
Source Control: Git
Following skills are DESIRED but not required:
Languages: JavaScript, Python, SQL
Frameworks: Angular, Agile SDLC, Gradle
Experience or interest in biotech or pharmaceutical industry
Experience with LIMS
Experience with distributed, cloud-based architectures
Continuous integration and deployment (Jenkins, Gradle, SonarQube)

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today!

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Desired skills

Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
Exceptional customer focus
Desire to teach other engineers about technology in area of expertise

position: Intern, Graduate and Undergraduate - Software Engineer II - summer 2021 - remote
description:
From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. 

During the Starbucks Summer Internship Program, you will: 

Influence business performance: make an impact through meaningful project work.  

Develop professionally: enhance your skills at workshops and business overviews. 

Foster connection: grow your network as you meet and learn from senior Starbucks leaders. 

About the Starbucks Business Intelligence & Data Services Team 

Starbucks Business Intelligence and Data Services (BIDS) is responsible for providing Data and Insights company-wide. Our Information Services Engineering team is in a unique position to enable to develop data services at scale. With the team working on large streams of data, we‘re looking for Software Engineer or Application Developer interns to support high scale and availability data services. As a key member of our team, you will assist us in building out the next generation data services platform and scalable API services. 

 

We’d love to hear from students with the following background: 

Currently enrolled into an undergraduate or graduate Computer Science or Software Engineering degree program

Python, SQL, No SQL, Java, Scala or C++ experience is highly desired. 

Superior strategic thinking and problem-solving skills. 

Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. 

Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills. 

Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines. 

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing. 

Strong understanding of machine learning theory and big data concepts/processes. 

Prior experience with Cloud technology like AWS or Azure platform or Enterprise Application platform 

Mid-level programming experience; ability to build prototypes and understand existing code base. 

Attention to detail and ability to thoroughly think through problems. 

 

About the Starbucks Summer Internship Program: 

The Starbucks Technology Internship Program is paid, full time, 12 week program, designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain meaningful work experience in a field of interest and expertise within the Starbucks Technology Enterprise. This is a pipeline for full-time talent; each student selected for a Starbucks internship may be considered for full-time career openings upon successful completion of their internship and as opportunities become available within the organization.

We are looking for a passionate and energetic intern to undertake real-world commercial challenges of enterprise software development. You will be working on developing and contributing to enterprise EDA software. Ideal candidate is an advanced EE major (preferably student) with very strong CS background or an advanced CS major.

Qualifications

1. Passionate about developing software tools/apps that are intuitive and a pleasure to use. And passionate about developing code that is easy to maintain, well architected and documented, and reusable.
2. Proficiency in object-oriented analysis, design & programming.
3. Strong in programming and working knowledge of C++.
4. Programming experience on Windows (Visual Studio) and/or Linux development environments
5. Able to communicate effectively
6. Current student studying for MS/ in EE/CS/ECE
7. Prior knowledge on software development and circuit design.
8. Good to have the knowledge and experience of
- Signal integrity challenges and design
- Analog/RF/Microwave design
- ADS circuit simulator

The Enterprise Robotic Processing Automation team at MassMutual is seeking a Summer 2021 intern who is interested in assisting the Robotics team in building automation applications.  The work in this group is exciting, innovative and always changing!  You’ll have the opportunity to assist in cutting edge technology with building automation robots  in a collaborative team environment while also getting professional exposure contributing to production, project and team deliverables. If you are interested in pursuing an IT career with a team that has a focus on their customers and you are eager to learn and grow, check this out!

The Team:

Robotics is growing!  The RPA team is tasked with creating “bots” that improve efficiencies across systems, both new and old. The team consists primarily of developers that work on projects supporting multiple lines of business across the enterprise.  As the RPA Intern, you’ll participate in team meetings and developer huddles that will give you exposure to professionals and the approaches they take with their design, code, testing, and overall process on how the team decides how to build certain “bots.”

The Impact:

As an intern, you’ll work with business partners to understand their processes and how to improve it through automation.  You’ll have the opportunity to develop your own understanding of the RPA Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process.  As a RPA Intern you will use creative problem solving approaches to generate ideas to overcome obstacles.

  • Administer Jira, Teams and other project tracking applications
  • Research, design and implement applications that support Robotics

  • Interest and basic understanding of the software development life cycle
  • Ability to use logic and reasoning to problem solve complex issues
  • Eagerness to work with a diverse team of professionals
  • Must be authorized to work in the US without requiring work authorization sponsorship, both now and in the future

The Ideal Qualifications

  • High level of technical aptitude
  • Previous exposure to UiPath
  • Experience using Tableau, Alteryx, or other data visualization tool
  • Knowledge of Unix, Windows, Mainframe
  • Previous application development exposure or understanding of API
